description: A new rewriting of history about the former British prime minister is gaining traction in the United States, especially among President Donald Trump's MAGA base.

European steel and aluminum industries shrouded in trade uncertainty
Thousands of US passengers delayed after grounded United Airlines flights
description: The Federal Aviation Authority issued ground stops on Wednesday at several major airports in Denver, Newark, Houston and Chicago, the FAA's website said, which only applied to United planes, due to a systemwide problem the airline encountered. A little over an hour later, United stated the 'technology disruption' had been 'resolved.'

headline: War in Gaza causes rift within the British left
description: In the United Kingdom, Muslim communities and young urban voters have turned away from Labour, disappointed by its lack of initiative on the Palestinian conflict. Many say they are ready to join Jeremy Corbyn's new party.

headline: Outsider art: Two African artists somewhat lost amid the vast Decharme collection in Paris
description: At the Grand Palais, 402 works by 156 artists are on display in the Parisian building through September 21. Africa is represented by two draftsmen, one from Benin and one from Angola.

headline: Mojgan Habibi, chef: 'Before, I was afraid of everything. Now, I have found my freedom'
description: 'Refuge Recipes' (4/6). Iranian native Mojgan Habibi is the breakfast chef at Hôtel du Couvent in Nice. Khoresht mast, a dish reserved for special occasions and made with yogurt, spices, honey and meat, brings back memories of her happy youth in Isfahan before her marriage, when she was free to create and sing.

Agnès Varda's Parisian wanderings at the Musée Carnavalet
description: An original exhibition focuses on the artist's relationship with Paris, highlighting her photographic work and her atelier in the 14th arrondissement.

headline: Eighty years after Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, the fight for survivors' memories to live on
description: In Japan, the two cities have long promoted peace and nuclear disarmament, led by survivors of the 1945 nuclear bombings. As their voices fade, both cities are striving to carry their message forward.

headline: Sydney Sweeney's American Eagle ad sparks controversy online and pleases Donald Trump
description: With a slogan playing on the ambiguity between 'genes' and 'jeans' − 'Sydney Sweeney has great jeans' − the actress has sparked controversy. Some have accused her of promoting eugenics, while President Donald Trump has come to American Eagle's defense, triggering a surge in its stock price.
